abstract: Chinese lawyer Gao Zhisheng gives interview detailing torture he endured after 2010 detention; defender of Falun Gong and Nobel Peace Prize nominee appeared physically and mentally incapacitated when released to house arrest in 2014, yet pledges to remain in China.
lead_paragraph: A leading Chinese rights lawyer, Gao Zhisheng, said in his first interview in five years that he had been tortured with an electric baton to his face.

headline.main: China: Rights Advocate Describes Torture and Solitary Confinement
headline.print_headline: Asia; China: Rights Advocate Describes Torture and Solitary Confinement

snippet: A leading Chinese rights lawyer, Gao Zhisheng, said in his first interview in five years that he had been tortured with an electric baton to his face.
